intro: Gilia brecciarum subsp. argusana, commonly known as the Sierra gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a white or yellow throat. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is known for its adaptability to arid environments. The subspecies argusana is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and floral morphology.
